text:
Jack Edwards  
Project Engineer  
Location   Preston, Lancashire  
Phone  07972 164293  
E-mail  jedwards7306@gmail.com   
  
Mechanically oriented  Project Engineer with 4 years of experience within the Food, Chemical and 
Pharmaceutical industries, driving over 20 projects to completion. Skilled in overseeing technical staff and 
checking that projects are completed on schedule, within budget and according to specifications. 
Highly skilled in 3D modelling and design (Invento r, AutoCAD & SolidWorks) and experienced in reviewing 
technical drawings and documents. Thrives in full lifecycle project delivery, focused on client satisfaction 
and overall profitable outcomes.  
 
Work History  
2017 -09 - Current  Junior Project Engineer   
Hosokawa Micron, Runcorn, Cheshire  
• Communicated  
Jack Edwards  
Project Engineer  
Location   Preston, Lancashire  
Phone  07972 164293  
E-mail  jedwards7306@gmail.com   
  
Mechanically oriented  Project Engineer with 4 years of experience within the Food, Chemical and 
Pharmaceutical industries, driving over 20 projects to completion. Skilled in overseeing technical staff and 
checking that projects are completed on schedule, within budget and according to specifications. 
Highly skilled in 3D modelling and design (Invento r, AutoCAD & SolidWorks) and experienced in reviewing 
technical drawings and documents. Thrives in full lifecycle project delivery, focused on client satisfaction 
and overall profitable outcomes.  
 
Work History  
2017 -09 - Current  Junior Project Engineer   
Hosokawa Micron, Runcorn, Cheshire  
• Communicated with industrial equipment installers to deliver technical 
support throughout project execution.  
• Liaised with company executives and project managers to acquire 
resources to move projects forward.  
• Evaluated change order requests in response to out -of-scope work activities 
and developing field conditions.  
• Planned and managed engineering projects and continuous improvement 
programs to reduce labour and costs.  
• Made recommendations to improve design, construction means  and 
methods and ma terials based on field or changing conditions.  
• Determined and scheduled priorities as required to progress engineering 
work.  
• Monitored installation of materials and equipment for compliance with 
drawings and specifications.  
• Designed equipment for manufactu re through use of 3D design packages.  
• Provided solutions for Hazardous Area (Ex) facilities.  
• Managed up to 6 projects at any one time.  
2016 -09 - 2017 -09  Apprentice Mechanical Fitter   
Hosokawa Micron, Runcorn, Cheshire  
• Dismantled and reassembled delicate mechanisms.  
• Reviewed finished equipment for accurate fit and assembly.  
• Measured, threaded and cut materials to correct angles.  
• Conducted thorough inspects and tests of previously installed systems to 
locate and correct faults.  
• Carried out Risk Assessments for on -site activities.  
2015 -09 - 2017 -09  Restaurant Waiter   
The Italian Orchard, Preston, Lancashire  
Education  
2017 -09 - Current  Bachelor of Science: Mechanical Engineering   
University of Central Lancashire (UCLan) - Preston., Lancashire  
I currently study part time at the University of Central Lancashire, alongside  my 
full time Project Engineering Role.  
Throughout the course I have scored highly, and I am on track for a First -Class 
Degree.  
2010 -09 - 2017 -09  A Levels: Maths , Physics, Design   
Kirkham Grammar School - Kirkham, Lancashire  
I attended Kirkham Grammar School from the age of 12, taking a keen interest 
in Math , Design and Sport. My time at the school not only gave me a base 
understanding of mathematica l and design principles but  allowed me to 
develop my soft skills. My ability to work as a team was nurtured throughout my 
time at the school, and I worked on my leadership qualities on and off the 
sports field. I held the position of House Captain for my final two years, prefect 
before that. Dedication and perseverance are two traits that were moulded 
into me during my final two years at the school, where our rugby team went 
two full seasons unbeaten, being named the third best team in the country.  
Accomplishments  
Highly Commended for Young Talent in the Chemical Industry

Excellent

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
